title: 3D-Micro XRF and XRD Analysis with Capillary Optics
content: X-ray fluorescence analysis has been applied with X-ray micro beam of small spot. In the laboratory, an X-ray microbeam can be created by using X-ray focusing optics such as polycapillary X-ray lens. Micro-XRF analysis measures the elemental distributions by scanning the sample. A confocal micro-XRF (CM-XRF) is one of special configurations of micro-XRF, and it is a unique elemental analytical technique which enables depth elemental imaging inside the sample [1]. This technique enables 3 dimensional XRF analysis by scanning the sample, as shown in Fig. 1. In my presentations, fundamentals of X-ray focusing optics, Micro-XRF, CM-XRF, and their applications to forensic samples, industrial samples, etc. will be shown [2].
